issue.title: Release Schedule for 31.0
issue.body:
Here is a proposed release schedule for `v31.0`, the next major release of Bitcoin Core.
The dates are set to target a release in early April.

## 2026-02-06 :heavy_check_mark:
- Open Transifex translations for `v31.0`
- Soft translation string freeze (no large or non-critical string changes until release)
- Finalize and close translations for `v29.0`

## 2026-02-20 :construction:
- Feature freeze (bug fixes only until release)
- Translation string freeze (no more source language changes until release)

## 2026-03-10 :construction:
- Anything needed before branch-off, see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/release-process.md
- Split off `31.x` branch from `master`
- Start RC cycle, tag and release `v31.0rc1`
- Start merging for `32.x` on `master` branch

## 2026-04-10 :construction:
- Tag `v31.0` (aim).

If any specific dates are a problem for you, please leave a comment.

labels.name: Tracking Issue
labels.description: Tracks longer-running projects and releases. Gathers TODOs, issues, PRs, and status updates.

For Polish: I translated the brand new labels. I went to review everything for completeness. I found some typos and errors and fixed them, but I also found some translated gaps (about 150 out of 1200+) which I'll translate.
I should have it tomorrow'ish.

> Hi [@hebasto](https://github.com/hebasto) French is done but for the strings I asked you about on Transifex: https://app.transifex.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/translate/#fr/qt-translation-031x?q=reviewed%3Ano%20comment%3Ahebasto

All new comments on Transifex have been addressed. Apologies for the delay.
The [LLM translation review](https://github.com/maflcko/b-c-gui-translations-review) is a valuable tool. Errors that made sense were fixed in the French translation.

Sorry for my late reaction. Czech translation should be completed except two strings which I am not able to save after edit.

> Sorry for my late reaction. Czech translation should be completed except two strings which I am not able to save after edit.

Have a look at the [1] [other] buttons at the top right side of Transiflex. You need to provide both translations to press the save button.
